decks.notes: This deck focuses on playing fast and aggressive Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Using mana acceleration like Grim Monolith and Simian Spirit Guide, the deck can quickly play powerful threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. With strong creature density and disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total before they can stabilize or set up their own game plan. It also includes cards like Dismember and Oblivion Sower to deal with opposing threats and gain advantages.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressively with powerful red and blue spells that can control the board while also dealing direct damage to the opponent. The deck utilizes cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Delver of Secrets to put pressure on the opponent early in the game, while also using counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its own threats. Wasteland is included to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while cards like True-Name Nemesis provide a strong finisher. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they can establish their own strategy.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token. The deck includes cards like Elvish Reclaimer, Crop Rotation, and Vampire Hexmage to tutor for the key pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Cards like Satyr Wayfinder, Stitcher's Supplier, and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis provide additional value and filling the graveyard. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo. The main goal is to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful threat.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy using efficient burn spells and counterspells. By utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Dreadhorde Arcanist, Delver of Secrets, and Young Pyromancer, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while also having the ability to protect its own threats through cards like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also utilizes cards like Price of Progress to punish opponents for playing nonbasic lands, making it difficult for them to stabilize and turn the game in their favor.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly get big creatures into play from the graveyard using cards like Entomb, Exhume, Animate Dead, and Reanimate. This combo-centric strategy aims to cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Tidespout Tyrant into play early in the game to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruption elements like Chancellor of the Annex and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's plans. The key to success is executing the reanimation combo efficiently while navigating through opposing interaction.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ashen Rider, then using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back into play for a strong combo finish. It also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Unmask to disrupt opponents' strategies and protect the combo. The deck aims to win the game quickly and efficiently through reanimating big threats before the opponent has a chance to respond.

This Burn deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by efficiently using low-cost spells and aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. It aims to control the board and apply pressure early on, with cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel punishing opponents for casting spells. The deck also packs powerful finishing spells like Fireblast and Exquisite Firecraft to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with direct damage and prevent them from mounting a defense.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategies and stabilize its own board presence. Thespian's Stage and Dark Depths combo for a powerful threat, while cards like Rishadan Port and Wasteland disrupt the opponent's mana base. Life from the Loam and Sylvan Library provide card advantage and consistency. The deck aims to grind out the opponent through attrition and resource denial, ultimately overwhelming them with its versatile land-based control strategy.

The main concept of this Aggro Eldrazi deck is to quickly deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail. By utilizing fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors, as well as colorless lands like Eye of Ugin and Cavern of Souls, the deck can overwhelm the opponent with high-impact threats and efficient removal spells like Dismember. The inclusion of utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland further enhances the deck's disruptive elements.

The main idea of this Grixis Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent by playing efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, Gurmag Angler, and True-Name Nemesis. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Force of Will. In addition, the deck includes versatile spells like Lightning Bolt for removal and card selection tools like Ponder and Brainstorm to help maintain tempo and card advantage. Finally, the deck includes mana denial elements with Wasteland to further disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence and controlling the game through efficient spells and creatures. It utilizes a mix of card advantage engines like Ancestral Vision and Sylvan Library, along with powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With access to powerful planeswalkers like Dack Fayden and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy, the deck aims to out-tempo and out-value the opponent to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience to cheat giant creatures like Emrakul and Griselbrand into play without paying their mana cost. This allows the player to quickly overwhelm their opponent with powerful threats. The deck also includes a variety of ways to protect these combos, such as counter spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm. The mana base is built to support these fast plays with lands like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. This combo deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with these high-impact creatures, providing a fast and powerful win condition. The deck also utilizes cantrips like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to dig for combo pieces, while also packing disruption like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect its game plan. The deck features a strong mana base with fetch lands and fast mana sources like Lotus Petal.

The main concept of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing the synergy between artifact creatures and powerful artifacts such as Arcbound Ravager and Steel Overseer. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Lodestone Golem. The deck's mana base is designed to support its aggressive gameplay, with cards like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors allowing for explosive starts and powerful plays early in the game.

This deck focuses on quick tempo plays and aggressive creatures to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. By utilizing efficient counterspells and cantrips, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a threatening board presence. The combination of efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer with versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and True-Name Nemesis allows the deck to adapt to different matchups and stay ahead in the game. The mana base is streamlined to ensure smooth casting of spells and to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively build up a board presence using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with countermagic like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also includes versatile burn spells such as Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning to finish off the opponent or remove key threats. By applying pressure early and maintaining control of the game with disruptive spells, the deck aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent to secure a victory.
